ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.1.1_0: One hundred years after the Buddha had attained final extinguishment, the Vajjian monks of Vesālī proclaimed ten practices as allowable:
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.1.2_0: he goes to the village of a hot cotton-wool; the marks of an eon is permissible; the bodies are allowed to live in the same place as before.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.1.3_0: At that time Venerable Yasa of Kākaṇḍa was wandering in the Vajjian country, when he arrived at Vesālī.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.1.4_0: There he stayed in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.1.5_0: Soon afterwards, on the day of the observance procedure, the Vajjian monks of Vesālī filled a bronze bowl with water and placed it in the midst of the Sangha of monks. Whenever a lay follower of Vesālī came, they said,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.1.6_0: “Give a _kahāpaṇa_ coin to the Sangha, or half a _kahāpaṇa_, or a _pāda_, or a _māsaka_.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.1.8_0: But Yaso said to the lay followers,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.1.9_0: “Don’t give a _kahāpaṇa_ to the Sangha, or half a _kahāpaṇa_, or a _pāda_, or a _māsaka_.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.1.10_0: gold, silver, and money are not allowable for the Sakyan ascetics.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.1.12_0: nor receive gold, silver, or money.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.1.13_0: The Sakyan ascetics have given up gems and gold, and live without gold, silver, and money.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.1.14_0: But although Yasa said this, the lay followers continued to give money to the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.1.15_0: The next morning the Vajjian monks shared out the money evenly.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.1.18_0: “There is no share for me. I don’t accept money.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.2.2_0: “Yasa is abusing and reviling the lay followers who have faith and confidence. He’s destroying their confidence.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.2.3_0: Well then, let’s do a legal procedure of reconciliation against him.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.2.5_0: “The Buddha has laid down a rule
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.2.6_0: that a monk who has had a legal procedure of reconciliation done against himself should be given a monk as companion messenger.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.2.7_0: Please give me a companion monk.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.2.8_0: They appointed one monk and gave him to Yasa as companion messenger.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.2.9_0: Yasa entered Vesālī with his companion and said to the lay followers there,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.2.10_0: “It seems that I’m abusing and reviling the venerable lay followers who have faith and confidence, and that I’m destroying their confidence,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.2.11_0: since I speak of what is contrary to the Teaching as contrary to the Teaching and of the Teaching as the Teaching, and since I speak of what is contrary to the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law and of the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.1_0: “On one occasion the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.3_0: ‘Mendicants, these four corruptions obscure the sun and moon, so they don’t shine and glow and radiate.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.4_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.4_1: It’s the corruptions that obscure the sun and moon, so they don’t shine and glow and radiate.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.5_0: It’s not that obscure the sun and moon, so they don’t shine and glow and radiate.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.7_0: An eclipse of Rāhu, lord of demons ...
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.8_0: These are four corruptions that obscure the sun and moon, so they don’t shine and glow and radiate.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.9_0: In the same way, there are these four defilements of ascetics and brahmins that stop them from shining and radiating:
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.10_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.11_0: There are some ascetics and brahmins who are drinking alcohol and running all loves. They don’t drink it.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.12_0: This is the first thing that corrupts ascetics and brahmins ...
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.14_0: This is the second thing that corrupts ascetics and brahmins ...
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.16_0: This is the third thing that corrupts ascetics and brahmins ...
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.17_0: and making a living through wrong livelihood.’
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.19_0: This is the fourth thing that corrupts ascetics and brahmins ...
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.20_0: These are the four defilements of ascetics and brahmins that stop them from shining and radiating:
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.21_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.22_0: Having said this, the Teacher added:
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.24_0: are plagued by greed and hate;
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.32_0: are plagued by greed and hate;
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.34_0: the Kinsman of the Sun, so skilled in means,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.36_0: are plagued by greed and hate;
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.40_0: bondservants of craving, full of attachments,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.41_0: they swell the horrors of the charnel ground,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.43_0: This is the venerables who have faith and confidence, and that I’m destroying their confidence, and that I’m destroying their confidence.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.3.44_0: since I speak of what is contrary to the Teaching as contrary to the Teaching and of the Teaching as the Teaching, and since I speak of what is contrary to the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law and of the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.2_0: Now at that time while the king’s retinue was sitting together in the royal compound this discussion came up among them,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.3_0: ‘Gold, silver, and money are allowable for the Sakyan ascetics;
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.5_0: and receive gold, silver, and money.’
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.6_0: Now at that time the officials was sitting in that assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.7_0: And he said to that assembly,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.9_0: gold, silver, and money are not allowable for the Sakyan ascetics.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.11_0: nor receive gold, silver, or money.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.12_0: The Sakyan ascetics have given up gems and gold, and live without gold, silver, and money.’
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.13_0: And he was able to persuade the gathering.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.14_0: Then Maṇiḷaka’s son went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.15_0: and told him what had happened,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.16_0: ‘Well, sir, while the king’s retinue was sitting together in the royal compound this discussion came up among them,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.17_0: gold, silver, and money are allowable for the Sakyan ascetics.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.19_0: and receive gold, silver, and money.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.20_0: When I said this, I said to him,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.22_0: gold, silver, and money are not allowable for the Sakyan ascetics.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.24_0: nor receive gold, silver, or money.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.25_0: The Sakyan ascetics have given up gems and gold, and live without gold, silver, and money.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.26_0: I was able to persuade that assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.27_0: adding, ‘Venerable Sir, have I explained in accordance with the Teaching so that I can’t be legitimately criticized or censured?’
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.28_0: ‘Indeed, in answering this way you repeat what I’ve said.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.29_0: They don’t misrepresent me with an untruth. Your explanation is in line with the teaching, and there are no legitimate grounds for rebuke and criticism.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.30_0: Because the Sakyan ascetics are not allowable for the Sakyan ascetics.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.32_0: nor receive gold, silver, or money.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.33_0: The Sakyan ascetics have given up gems and gold, and live without gold, silver, and money.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.34_0: Whoever is allowed gold, silver, and money is also allowed the pleasures of the world.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.35_0: And if the five kinds of sensual stimulation are proper for them, you should definitely regard them like this:
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.36_0: an ascetic and not a son of the Sakyan;
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.37_0: Still, I say that anyone who needs grass may look for it,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.41_0: But under no circumstances should they accept or look for gold, silver, or money.’
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.42_0: This is the venerables who have faith and confidence, and that I’m destroying their confidence, and that I’m destroying their confidence.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.4.43_0: since I speak of what is contrary to the Teaching as contrary to the Teaching and of the Teaching as the Teaching, and since I speak of what is contrary to the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law and of the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.5.1_0: This one time the Buddha was laid down in the Sakyan land of the Upananda, using gold and money.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.5.2_0: This is the venerables who have faith and confidence, and that I’m destroying their confidence, and that I’m destroying their confidence.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.5.3_0: since I speak of what is contrary to the Teaching as contrary to the Teaching and of the Teaching as the Teaching, and since I speak of what is contrary to the Monastic Law as contrary to the Monastic Law and of the Monastic Law as the Monastic Law.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.6.1_0: And the lay followers of Vesālī said to Yasa,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.6.5_0: We’ll do our best to supply you with robes, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicines.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.6.6_0: Yasa had them a messenger and then went to the monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.7.1_0: Soon afterwards the Vajjian monks asked him,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.7.2_0: “Did Yasa ask the lay followers for forgiveness?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.7.3_0: “The lay followers have acted badly toward us.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.7.4_0: They now regard Yasa as the only Sakyan ascetic,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.7.7_0: “Yasa has regarded the Kākaṇḍakāniputta as a householder, to take householders in our presence.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.7.8_0: Well then, let’s do a procedure of ejection.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.7.9_0: They assembled to do a legal procedure of ejection against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.7.10_0: Yasa rose up into the air and reappeared at Kosambī.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.7.11_0: Yasa then sent a message to the monks at Pāvā and to the monks in Avantī in the southern region:
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.7.14_0: before what is contrary to the Teaching shines forth and the Teaching is obstructed;
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.7.15_0: before what is contrary to the Monastic Law shines forth and the Monastic Law is obstructed;
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.7.16_0: before those who speak contrary to the Teaching become strong and those who speak in accordance with it become weak;
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.7.17_0: those who speak contrary to the Monastic Law become strong and those who speak in accordance with it become weak.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.8.1_0: Yasa then traveled to Venerable Sambhūta Sāṇavāsī who was staying on the Ahogaṅga mountain.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.8.4_0: “The Vajjian monks of Vesālī proclaim these ten practices.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.8.5_0: he goes to the village of a hot cotton-wool; the marks of an eon is permissible; the bodies are allowed to live in the same place as before.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.8.7_0: before what is contrary to the Teaching shines forth and the Teaching is obstructed;
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.8.8_0: before what is contrary to the Monastic Law shines forth and the Monastic Law is obstructed;
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.8.9_0: before those who speak contrary to the Teaching become strong and those who speak in accordance with it become weak;
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.8.10_0: those who speak contrary to the Monastic Law become strong and those who speak in accordance with it become weak.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.8.12_0: Soon afterwards, sixty monks from Pāvā—
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.8.13_0: all of them wilderness-dwellers, almsfood-only eaters, rag-robe wearers, three-robe owners, and perfected—
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.8.15_0: And eighty-eight monks from Avantī in the southern region—
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.8.16_0: some of them wilderness-dwellers, some almsfood-only eaters, some rag-robe wearers, some three-robe owners, but all perfected—
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.1_0: Then, as the senior monks were consulting one another, it occurred to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.2_0: “This legal issue is going to be contentious and difficult.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.3_0: How can we get supporters, so that we will be stronger?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.4_0: At this time Venerable Revata was staying at Soreyya.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.5_0: He was learned and a master of the tradition; he was an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the summaries; he was knowledgeable and competent, had a sense of conscience, and was afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.8_0: He was learned and a master of the tradition; he was an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the summaries; he was knowledgeable and competent, had a sense of conscience, and was afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.9_0: If we get Revata as a supporter, we’ll be stronger.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.10_0: Revata heard this conversation between the senior monks
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.12_0: as the Elder monks were consulting one’s elder,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.14_0: “This legal issue is going to be contentious and difficult.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.15_0: It would not be appropriate for me to stay away from such a legal issue.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.16_0: But now these monks are coming,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.17_0: and I won’t be at ease when they crowd me in.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.18_0: Let me leave before they arrive.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.19_0: And he went from Soreyya to Saṅkassa.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.20_0: The senior monks went to Soreyya
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.23_0: that he had gone to Saṅkassa.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.24_0: Revata then went from Saṅkassa to Kaṇṇakujja.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.25_0: When the senior monks went to Saṅkassa
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.29_0: And Revata went from Kaṇṇakujja to Udumbara.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.30_0: When the senior monks went to Kaṇṇakujja, they asked them,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.34_0: And Revata went from Udumbara to Aggaḷapura.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.35_0: When the senior monks went to Udumbara
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.39_0: And he went from Revata to Aruḷapura.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.40_0: When the senior monks went to Aggaḷapura
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.9.44_0: Finally the senior monks caught up with Revata at Sahajāti.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.1_0: Sambhūta Sāṇavāsī then said to Yasa,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.2_0: “Revata is learned and a master of the tradition; he is an expert on the Teaching, on the Monastic Law, and on the summaries; he is knowledgeable and competent, has a sense of conscience, and is afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.3_0: If we ask Revata a question, he would be capable of spending the whole night answering just that one.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.4_0: Now, soon he will ask a pupil monk to chant.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.5_0: Once the chanting is finished, go up to Revata and ask him about these ten practices.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.7_0: Soon afterwards, Revata sent a pupil monk to chant.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.8_0: Soon afterwards, when the chanting was finished, Yasa approached Revata, bowed, sat down,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.12_0: “Is it allowable to carry salt in a horn
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.17_0: “Is it allowable to eat at the wrong time, so long as the shadow of the sundial is within two fingerbreadths of midday?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.21_0: “When you have finished your meal and refused an invitation to eat more, is it allowable to eat non-leftover food if you intend to go to the next village?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.25_0: “When there are a number of monasteries within the same monastic boundary, is it allowable to do the observance-day procedure separately?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.29_0: “Is it allowable to do a legal procedure with an incomplete Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.30_0: with the intention of getting consent from the absent monks afterwards?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.34_0: “Is it allowable to follow the practices of one’s preceptors or teachers?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.38_0: “When you have finished your meal and refused an invitation to eat more, is it allowable to drink that which is halfway between milk and curd, if it’s not leftover?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.42_0: “Is it allowable to drink that which has started to ferment, but which hasn’t yet become a proper alcoholic drink?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.48_0: “The Vajjian monks of Vesālī proclaim these ten practices.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.50_0: before what is contrary to the Teaching shines forth and the Teaching is obstructed;
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.51_0: before what is contrary to the Monastic Law shines forth and the Monastic Law is obstructed;
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.52_0: before those who speak contrary to the Teaching become strong and those who speak in accordance with it become weak;
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.53_0: those who speak contrary to the Monastic Law become strong and those who speak in accordance with it become weak.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.54_0: Saying, “Yes,” he consented to Yasa’s request.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:1.10.55_0: The first recitation section is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.1.1_0: The Vajjian monks of Vesālī heard,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.1.2_0: “It seems Yasa wants to raise this legal issue and is looking for supporters. And it seems he is gaining support.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.1.4_0: “This legal issue is going to be contentious and difficult.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.1.5_0: How can we get supporters, so that we will be stronger?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.1.7_0: “Venerable Revata is learned and a master of the tradition; he is an expert on the Teaching, on the Monastic Law, and on the summaries; he is knowledgeable and competent, has a sense of conscience, and is afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.1.8_0: If we get Revata as a supporter, we’ll be stronger.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.1.9_0: Soon afterwards the Vajjian monks gave plenty of requisites to Sāgata, saying,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.1.10_0: a bowl, a robe, a sitting mat, a needle case, a belt, a water filter, and a water strainer.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.1.11_0: Taking those requisites, they traveled by boat upstream to Sahajāti.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.1.12_0: After disembarking, they had a meal at the foot of a tree.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.2.1_0: Just then Venerable Sāḷha was in seclusion, wondering,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.2.2_0: “Who speak in accordance with the Teaching,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.2.3_0: the monks from the east or the monks from Pāvā?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.2.4_0: Reflecting on the Teaching and the Monastic Law, it occurred to him,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.2.5_0: “The monks from the east speak contrary to the Teaching, but the monks from Pāvā don’t.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.2.6_0: Then a certain deity, knowing what Venerable Sāḷha was thinking,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.2.7_0: Then, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, they vanished from the bank of the river Vaggumudā, and reappeared in the presence of the Buddha in the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.2.7_1: in the same way the disappearance of Venerable Sāḷha did not appear in front of Sāḷha.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.2.9_0: “Good, Venerable Sāḷha! His words are timely, and the mendicants who speak contrary to the Teaching—
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.2.10_0: So then, take a stand in accordance with the Teaching.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.2.11_0: “Previously, God-King, I am standing in these days,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.2.12_0: And I too won’t reveal my view in case I’m appointed to deal with this legal issue.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.1_0: The Vajjian monks then went to Revata and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.3_0: a bowl, a robe, a sitting mat, a needle case, a belt, and a water filter.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.4_0: Not wanting to accept them, he replied, “There is no need. My bowl and robes are complete.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.5_0: At this time a monk called Uttara, who had twenty years of seniority, was Revata’s attendant.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.6_0: They then went to Uttara and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.8_0: a bowl, a robe, a sitting mat, a needle case, a belt, and a water filter.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.9_0: Not wanting to accept them, he replied, “There is no need. My bowl and robes are complete.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.10_0: “People brought monastic requisites to the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.11_0: If the Buddha received them, they were pleased.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.12_0: If he didn’t, they brought them to Venerable Ānanda instead,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.13_0: saying, ‘Venerable, please accept these monastic requisites.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.14_0: It will be as if they were received by the Buddha himself.’
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.15_0: So please accept these monastic requisites.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.16_0: It will be as if they were received by the elder himself.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.17_0: Then Venerable Uttara pressed the Vajjian mendicants of Vesālī, as easily as a robe-cloth was being tormented.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.20_0: ‘Sir, please say this in the midst of the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.21_0: ‘There are Buddhas arise in the country of Buddhas.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.22_0: the monks from the east speak contrary to the Teaching, but the monks from Pāvā don’t.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.25_0: and told him what he had been asked to say.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.26_0: ‘There are Buddhas arise in the country of Buddhas.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.27_0: the monks from the east speak contrary to the Teaching, but the monks from Pāvā don’t.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.28_0: Revata replied, “You’re urging me to act contrary to the Teaching,” and he dismissed Uttara.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.29_0: Soon afterwards the Vajjian monks asked Uttara,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.32_0: you’re urging me to act contrary to the Teaching, and the senior mendicant.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.33_0: “Didn’t you have twenty years of seniority?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.3.34_0: “Yes. Nevertheless, I live with formal support from him because I respect him.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.4.1_0: Then the Sangha gathered to deliberate on that legal issue.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.4.3_0: “Please, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.4.4_0: If we were to resolve this legal issue here, it might be that the monks who started the ten practices would reopen it.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.4.5_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should resolve this legal issue in the place where it arose.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.4.7_0: to deliberate on that legal issue.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.4.8_0: At that time there was a monk called Sabbakāmī who had been ordained for one hundred and twenty years and was the most senior monk in the world. He had been a student of Venerable Ānanda and was now staying at Vesālī.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.4.11_0: Please go to Sabbakāmī at the appropriate time and ask about these ten practices.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.4.14_0: had pregnant a dwelling place prepared for venerable Revata, with Revata’s dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.4.16_0: that the old monk did not lie down,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.4.17_0: he too did not lie down.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.4.19_0: that the tired monk who had just arrived did not lie down,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.4.20_0: he too did not lie down.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.5.1_0: Getting up early in the morning, Sabbakāmī said to Revata,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.5.3_0: “My main meditation, Sir, is good will.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.5.6_0: “Formerly, too, when I was a householder, I habitually practiced good will,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.5.7_0: and now it’s my main meditation. Besides, I attained perfection long ago.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.5.10_0: “Your meditation is that of a great man,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.5.11_0: It is a great man whose meditation is empty.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.5.12_0: “Formerly, too, when I was a householders, I habitually practiced emptiness,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.5.13_0: and now it’s my main meditation. Besides, I attained perfection long ago.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.1_0: Now this venerable Sāketa became unfinished when the senior mendicants arrived.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.2_0: Sambhūta Sāṇavāsī approached Sabbakāmī, bowed, sat down,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.3_0: Sambhūta Sāṇavāsī then said to Sabbakāmī,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.4_0: “The Vajjian monks of Vesālī proclaim these ten practices.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.5_0: he goes to the village of a hot cotton-wool; the marks of an eon is permissible; the bodies are allowed to live in the same place as before.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.6_0: Now you have learned much, both of the Teaching and the Monastic Law, at the feet of your preceptor.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.7_0: When you reflect on the Teaching and the Monastic Law,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.8_0: who speaks in accordance with the Teaching,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.9_0: the monks from the east or the monks from Pāvā?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.10_0: “You too have learned much, both of the Teaching and the Monastic Law, at the feet of your preceptor.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.11_0: And when you reflect on the Teaching and the Monastic Law, how
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.12_0: who speaks in accordance with the Teaching,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.13_0: the monks from the east or the monks from Pāvā?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.14_0: “When I reflect like this, it occurs to me
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.15_0: that the monks from the east speak contrary to the Teaching, but the monks from Pāvā don’t.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.16_0: And I too won’t reveal my view in case I’m appointed to deal with this legal issue.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.17_0: “And when I reflect like this, it occurs to me too
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.18_0: that the monks from the east speak contrary to the Teaching, but the monks from Pāvā don’t.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.6.19_0: And I too won’t reveal my view in case I’m appointed to deal with this legal issue.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.1_0: Then the Sangha gathered to deliberate on that legal issue.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.2_0: But when the disciplinary issue was cut off, there is no need for one who understands.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.4_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.5_0: While we were deliberating, there was endless talk, but not a single statement that could be understood.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.6_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should resolve this legal issue by means of a committee.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.7_0: The Sangha then selected four monks from the east—
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.9_0: Venerable Sabbakāmī and Sāḷha, Khujjasobhita, Vāsabha, and Sāḷha.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.11_0: Venerable Revata, Venerable Sambhūta Sāṇavāsī, Venerable Yasa of Kākaṇḍa, and Venerable Sumana.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.13_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.14_0: While we were deliberating, there was endless talk, but not a single statement that could be understood.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.15_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should appoint four monks from the east and four from Pāvā to resolve this legal issue by means of a committee.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.17_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.18_0: While we were deliberating, there was endless talk, but not a single statement that could be understood.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.19_0: The Sangha appoints four monks from the east and four from Pāvā to resolve this legal issue by means of a committee.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.20_0: Any monk who approves of appointing four monks from the east and four from Pāvā to resolve this legal issue by means of a committee should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.21_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.22_0: The Sangha has appointed four monks from the east and four from Pāvā to resolve this legal issue by means of a committee.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.23_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.24_0: At that time there was a monk called Ajita who had ten years of seniority and was the Sangha’s reciter of the Monastic Code.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.26_0: to assign seats to the senior monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.28_0: “Where should we resolve this legal issue?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.30_0: “This is the difference between them is delightful and pleasant,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.31_0: Why don’t we resolve this legal issue?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.32_0: And they went to the Vālika Monastery
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.7.33_0: to deliberate on that legal issue.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.2_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.3_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, I will question Venerable Sabbakāmī on the Monastic Law.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.5_0: “Please, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.6_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, I will reply when asked by Revata about the Monastic Law.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.10_0: “Is it allowable to carry salt in a horn
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.11_0: and then eat it whenever the food is unsalted?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.14_0: “At Sāvatthī, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.16_0: “An offense entailing confession for eating what has been stored.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.17_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.18_0: The Sangha has decided on the first practice.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.19_0: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.20_0: I make a note of the first decision.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.23_0: “Is it allowable to eat at the wrong time, so long as the shadow of the sundial is within two fingerbreadths of midday?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.26_0: “At Rājagaha, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.28_0: “An offense entailing confession for eating at the wrong time.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.29_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.30_0: The Sangha has decided on the second practice.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.31_0: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.32_0: I make a note of the second decision.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.35_0: “When you have finished your meal and refused an invitation to eat more, is it allowable to eat non-leftover food if you intend to go to the next village?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.38_0: “At Sāvatthī, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.40_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.41_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.42_0: The Sangha has decided on the third practice.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.43_0: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.44_0: I make a note of the third decision.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.47_0: “When there are a number of monasteries within the same monastic boundary, is it allowable to do the observance-day procedure separately?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.50_0: “At Rājagaha, in what is connected to the observance-day procedure.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.52_0: “An act of wrong conduct for going beyond the Monastic Law.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.53_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.54_0: The Sangha has decided on the fourth practice.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.55_0: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.56_0: I make a note of the fourth decision.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.59_0: “Is it allowable to do a legal procedure with an incomplete Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.60_0: with the intention of getting consent from the absent monks afterwards?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.63_0: “In the section on Those from Campā, in the Monastic Law.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.65_0: “An act of wrong conduct for going beyond the Monastic Law.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.66_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.67_0: The Sangha has decided on the fifth practice.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.68_0: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.69_0: I make a note of the fifth decision.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.73_0: to follow the practices of one’s preceptors or teachers?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.74_0: That’s why I like to complain.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.76_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.77_0: The Sangha has decided on the sixth practice.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.78_0: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.79_0: I make a note of the sixth decision.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.82_0: “When you have finished your meal and refused an invitation to eat more, is it allowable to drink that which is halfway between milk and curd, if it’s not leftover?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.85_0: “At Sāvatthī, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.87_0: ‘If a monk eats in a group, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.88_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.89_0: The Sangha has decided on the seventh practice.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.90_0: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.91_0: I make a note of the seventh decision.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.94_0: “Is it allowable to drink that which has started to ferment, but which hasn’t yet become a proper alcoholic drink?”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.97_0: “At Kosambī, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.99_0: “An offense entailing confession for drinking alcohol.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.100_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.101_0: The Sangha has decided on the eighth practice.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.102_0: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.103_0: I make a note of the eighth decision.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.107_0: “At Sāvatthī, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.109_0: ‘If a monk cuts it down, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.110_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.111_0: The Sangha has decided on the ninth practice.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.112_0: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.113_0: I make a note of the ninth decision.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.117_0: “At Rājagaha, in the analysis of the Monastic Code.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.119_0: ‘If a monk has given consent to someone else and it is lost, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.120_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.121_0: The Sangha has decided on the tenth practice.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.122_0: This practice is contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.123_0: I make a note of the tenth decision.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.124_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.126_0: These ten practices are contrary to the Teaching, contrary to the Monastic Law, and a departure from the Teacher’s instruction.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.127_0: “The legal issue has been settled and properly resolved.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.128_0: Nevertheless, for the purpose of convincing the other monks, you should ask me about these ten practices also in the midst of the Sangha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.129_0: Revata then asked Sabbakāmī about these ten practices in the midst of the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.8.130_0: when questioned, I reply to every question.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.9.1_0: At this communal recitation of the Monastic Law there were seven hundred monks, neither more nor less. For this reason this communal recitation is called “The group of seven hundred”.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.9.2_0: The chapter on the group of seven hundred is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.9.9_0: Udumbara, decked like a golden statue,
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.9.16_0: The chapter on the group of seven hundred is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.9.17_0: The canonical text of the chapter is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd22:2.9.18_0: The canonical text of the Short Division is finished.
